author: wrowe
msg: Undo the damage to mirror sites.  We need to drop /httpd/ since the
mirrors would never pick up our redirects properly... and instead
redirect /httpd/ to /httpd.html ... and other /httpd/ to /
Sorry for the confusion.  Believes this cleans it up.

author: wrowe
msg: Fix all apache-site href/src references to root (not to a given server,
but simply root to /) so that www.apache.org/httpd/ will start to work.
Reported by: David Reid <dreid@jetnet.co.uk>

author: rbb
msg: If a bucket is split at the first or last character, then we should get
a zero length bucket and a bucket containing the original text.  Later
filters will either throw away the zero length bucket, or they will just
ignore it.  The problem is that if we return an error in those conditions,
then all filters need special logic whenever they are going to split a
bucket.  By always splitting, only a few selected buckets need the special
logic to deal with zero-length buckets.  This also fixes mod_include to not
have the special logic around it's split call.
